intro: Acomis lesteri, commonly known as the lesser acomis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy surface. Acomis lesteri is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions.
